info.event: Let's start by identifying the trigger that caused negative thoughts or emotions. The trigger can be an utterly insignificant event or even your own thought.
info.thought: Automatic thoughts are generated by an event and lead to the emergence of negative emotions. Emotions, in turn, cause a deterioration of the state and the emergence of new automatic thoughts. This results in a cycle of negativity, which is difficult to break out of. To prevent its occurrence, identify the automatic thought as soon as possible and record it in a journal.
info.body: Try to return to the moment the trigger occurred. Remember what unpleasant sensations were present in the body at that time.
info.behavior: What was your behavior afterward? What did you do after you experienced negative emotions?
info.response: After identifying the automatic thought, it is necessary to pay attention to it and reflect on it. As a rule, automatic thoughts contain logical errors and distortions. Your task is to provide a rational response to the distortions and form a new mindset.
info.conclusion: Describe the outcome of your work - how your emotions and thoughts have changed, what you plan to change in your reactions if a similar event occurs.
info.comparison: Give arguments supporting your automatic thought and arguments refuting it. This will help you understand how objective and real it is.

stepper.event: I screwed up a task at work
stepper.thought: I make mistakes in my work all the time, everyone around me hates me for it
stepper.body: Increased heart palpitations, heaviness in the chest.
stepper.response: There are no people who don't make mistakes, and I can't predict the thoughts of those around me
stepper.conclusion: The next time I make a mistake, I will not try to guess the reaction of others. I will also keep a checklist to check my work so that I don't make the same mistake again

description: Turn filling out your diary from a chore into a fun process. Instead of just recounting events, tell your day as an exciting story.
Artificial intelligence will help you: it will analyze your story and automatically suggest how best to fill out your diary by selecting the appropriate categories and fields.
You can always edit and flesh out what the AI has suggested, making the record even more personal and accurate.
Everything written will be saved in a diary, so your story won't be lost once it's analyzed.
AI makes the process of working with thoughts not only useful but also interesting, turning ordinary diary filling into creative self-expression.

automaticAnalysis.title: Recording emotions instead of thoughts
automaticAnalysis.description: Feelings cannot be refuted in an adaptive response and should be recorded in a separate step.
automaticAnalysis.right: I think I won’t be able to cope

automaticAnalysis.title: Vague formulations
automaticAnalysis.description: An automatic thought may be recorded too generally.
automaticAnalysis.right: I think my colleagues consider me incompetent

automaticAnalysis.title: Recording facts instead of interpretations
automaticAnalysis.description: It is important to note your attitude toward the event. The fact of the event was recorded in the previous step.
automaticAnalysis.right: Now my boss will think I’m irresponsible

automaticAnalysis.title: Too complex and confusing formulation
automaticAnalysis.description: Thoughts should be recorded simply and clearly; otherwise, it will be difficult to provide an adaptive response.
automaticAnalysis.wrong: I tend to believe that my opinion doesn’t matter
automaticAnalysis.right: My opinion doesn’t matter to anyone

automaticAnalysis.title: Skipping the automatic thought
automaticAnalysis.description: Some people immediately record alternative thoughts or responses to automatic thoughts.
automaticAnalysis.right: I’m not sure I can handle it

automaticAnalysis.title: Ignoring key thoughts
automaticAnalysis.description: Sometimes people only record thoughts that seem more acceptable, ignoring key or painful automatic thoughts.
automaticAnalysis.wrong: I’m a bit worried about the future
